subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Mapping the Ocean Floor
description: Learn Mapping the Ocean Floor in one minute.

hook.text: We have better maps of Mars than of our own ocean floor. Over 80% remains unmapped in detail.

buildup.text: Sonar sends sound pulses down and measures the echoes. It's the only way to map deep water.

discovery.text: Marie Tharp mapped the Mid-Atlantic Ridge in the 1950s, proving continental drift was real.

twist.text: Her male boss initially dismissed her work as 'girl talk.' Her maps eventually proved plate tectonics.

climax.text: The Seabed 2030 project aims to map the entire ocean floor by 2030 using autonomous underwater vehicles.

punchline.text: A woman mapped the ocean floor and her boss called it girl talk.

quiz.question: What did Marie Tharp's ocean floor maps help prove?
